Column Comment.0: WORK ORDER IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the work order.
Column Comment.1: CONDITION OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique observation number for the conditionthat is required for the work order.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: WORK ORDER BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ROLE: A list of valid roles played bybusiness associates with respect to carrying out instructions for a work order. Rolesinclude shipping address, client etc.
Column Comment.4: BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for the business associatewho is involved with this work order as a client, service provider, intermediary etc.The BA may be a company, contact name etc.
Column Comment.5: CONDITION DESCRIPTION: In necessary, an unvalidated narrative description ofthe condition that must be met for the work order to proceed.
Column Comment.6: WORK ORDER CONDITION: Lists the pre-conditions that must exist in order for thiswork order to be completed or filled. Can indicate a need for approval, payment, for afacility to be taken off-line (for maintenance), for notification to besent out etc.
Column Comment.7: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsoriginal monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in this tableonly. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value,the original valueof the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.8: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.9: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.10: PAYMENT AMOUNT: the gross amount of the payment due from this BA. Note thatfull details about the costs for the work order may be tracked in the FINANCE tables.If more details about payment are required, use the OBLIGATIONS module.
Column Comment.12: PERCENT OF PAYMENT: Used when the BA is a payer for the work order, toindicate what percent of the entire payment is due from this BA. Note that full detailsabout the payments can be obtained from the FINANCE tables.
Column Comment.13: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.14: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: WORK ORDER TYPE: the type of work order, such as data circulation, flowing holeremediation, brokerage etc.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
